poem:
**Morning Headlines**

Under the guise of morning coffee,  
newsprint unwraps a day's dark gift:  
a parade of paper-thin horrors.  
The past unraveled in courtrooms,  
a city's breath stolen by quicksilver metal.  
We sip our rituals, asking the sky—  
blue as always, oblivious—  
how much weight these pages hold.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Trump administration orders release of Epstein court documents amid mounting pressure – US politics live 12.00pm BST More than 20 injured after vehicle drives into crowd in East Hollywood, LA fire department say Away from politics, the Los Angeles fire department (LAFD) is reporting that a vehicle has driven into a crowd of people in East Hollywood, injuring more than 20.Up to five people are in critical condition, a further eight to ten are in". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
